Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Pottery chalice
Description: A black pottery chalice with a wide circular rim and a wide bowl, that slopes down to the long stem, which ends in a high circular foot. Chalices were among the numerous forms of vessel used for drinking water, wine or other beverages. Clay was the most commonly used material for drinking vessels in Alexandria during the Hellenistic era.
